displayName.text: Vegan Quick Bites by Next Stop Vegan

formattedAddress: 1636 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Vegan Quick Bites by Next Stop Vegan
Vegan Quick Bites by Next Stop Vegan
Vegan Quick Bites by Next Stop Vegan

adrFormatAddress: 1636 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10040-3313, USA

originalText.text: I’m so happy about the opening of Vegan Quick bites! I’ve loved Next Stop Vegan food for years and now having a quick access closer to home is wonderful. It’s like vegan Thanksgiving. The atmosphere, the vibes and the food are top notch. I recommend getting more than one bowl and mix up all the yummy options. Top it off with some empanadas and you’re good to go. Delicious vegan Dominican food for everyone!

text.text: I’m so happy about the opening of Vegan Quick bites! I’ve loved Next Stop Vegan food for years and now having a quick access closer to home is wonderful. It’s like vegan Thanksgiving. Delicious vegan Dominican food for everyone!

originalText.text: Let me tell you how I have missed eating a chimi so bad and I could finally eat a vegan one. My heart ❤️ I was so excited. I also had some delicious empanadas. They were 3 for $10 and I thought that was great. They were jam packed and loved every bite. Will definitely be ordering from there again!

text.text: Let me tell you how I have missed eating a chimi so bad and I could finally eat a vegan one. My heart ❤️ I was so excited. I also had some delicious empanadas. They were 3 for $10 and I thought that was great. They were jam packed and loved every bite. Will definitely be ordering from there again!

originalText.text: Been trying to come here for a while, especially since I'm Dominican and from the area. I'll start off by saying that the empandas are really good. The macaroni and ground protein was probably my favorite out of the 3 I got. The patacon was good, but I felt like it needed something, maybe next time I'll get it with bread instead of the plantain bun. The chowfan seemed like an interesting choice as well, but after trying it, I wasn't a fan. I'm not vegan, so my personal preference would've been if it had tofu or something that mimics meat, I felt too much veggies in my order, although others wouldn't mind. I definitely want to come back and try the other stuff! Also, the staff is super nice.

I definitely want to come back and try the other stuff! Also, the staff is super nice.

originalText.text:
Wanted to try a new spot for lunch with a co-worker who is vegan. I eat vegan at times. I dont classify myself as such. I just love good food (periodt). If you are a vegan, vegetarian, good-food lover..... order or stop by this place. We ordered from GrubHub, and it was deee-lish-ooous! It's so good, so authentic. I loved every bite! We had the Mofonguitos- wow, you gotta try this. It had "quinoa-meat." There is no foolishness here, just good ingredients that you can see and taste. There's 2 to an order so my co-worker and I had one each. We then had the black bean burger (formerly veganator) it had Seitan, lettuce, onion, tomatoes, vegan cheese, pickles, and a TRUE black-bean burger! This was no franken-beyond-previously-known-as-food  here. It was delightful. Fyi- I do love a good beyond/morningstar burger at times.
But this burger! made with black beans and brown rice (per the menu), it was perfectly blended smooth, and EVERY bite was delicious. Now, I did remove the pickles as Im just not a pickle-in-my-food kinda girl. I had to try the seitan by itself in order to really taste it, but overall, I was NOT disappointed. It was a good burger. And even better, you dont need ketchup! I tried it with and without. Also, the burger came with fries....meh. It was a GrubHub order, and the order came quickly. However, unless my fries are piping hot, it doesn't matter where I get them from. I won't be impressed. I would def recommend anyone out there to give this place a try. Look at their menu and decide. But def try the Monfonguitos to start off! Enjoy!

originalText.text: I had El Plato, it came with White Rice, Black Beans w/cilantro sprinkles, Amarillos, Avocado (cut like a rose) Portobello Mushrooms sautéed w/ Red & Green Bell Peppers. Also had a Jack Pulled BBQ, it was very tasty. The place is Tiny but cute. I’d come again, during 5pm rush.
